Comment.value: RuralExit
Generic trigger used for spawning.
Generic trigger used for spawning.
Generic trigger used for spawning.
Generic trigger used for spawning.

This description flows out of the window. Make sure you read all of it.

Names
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
The waypoint's name, tag and resref must be the same. It MUST start with "tst_" and I advice to use a descriptive phrase for the rest of the name. Look at the available waypoints for examples. You can use up to 12 characters.

Variables
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
tst_boss_switch: set to 1 to spawn the boss blueprint
tst_max_1: maximum amount of spawntype 1
tst_resref_1: buleprint of spawntype 1
tst_resref_boss: blueprint id of the boss
tst_spawntypes: the number of spawntypes to use, excluding the boss

Values
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
tst_boss_switch: 0 or 1
tst_max_1: 0 to 5
tst_resref_1: the resref you find in the properties of a monster
tst_resref_boss: idem
tst_spawntypes: 0 to 4

Mind that you can use one boss and a maximum of 4 spawntypes. Of each spawntype you can spawn up to 5 creatures.
See the description of the  "tst template and decription" blueprint in the toolset.

Place this waypoint in an area as a target for the spawns scripts. You can place as many of them as you want. The spawn scripts pick up to 4 spawnpoints an area to spawn creatures on as long as there's one or more PCs in the area.
